title: Microsoft Sidewinder Strategic Commander (USB Device) - Any open source drivers or tools? [closed]
content:
Closed. This question is off-topic. It is not currently accepting answers.
                                
                            











 Questions asking for help reverse-engineering a specific system are off-topic unless they demonstrate an understanding of the concepts involved and clearly identify a specific problem.


Closed 9 years ago.







                        Improve this question
                    



I have an old USB gaming device called the Strategic Commander.  It was handy for strategy games like Age of Empires - allowing for easy left hand to control of scrolling, panning, zooming and using a variety of programmable hotkeys.  Today it's a useless/unsupported/forgotten item that sits in a drawer in my office.  I would like to use the device to help navigate in a 3D CAD environment like Blender or 3D Studio Max.  On Windows 7 & 8.
Is there any existing research/work available in this area?
Is there an open source driver framework?
Does anyone know Microsoft's official stance on 'hacking' this old hardware?
How should I get started?
Thanks!

answers_data.content:
